Articles.Content:
So I would really enjoy tourist contracts that require you to go above and beyond. Since that is pretty broad I would like to provide examples.

this one would go hand in hand with some volcanoes/ other cool stuff so: show 2 tourists interesting spots on duna. This would also give another use for rovers.

make contracts like: 3 tourists would like to have a good view while on minmus, so put them in a lawn mower chair and drive them around. Also this would require tourists to sit in chairs

make tourists that seek thrill: 2 tourists would like to experience 5-7g. Not more and not less.

That's not a problem with tourists. It's the contracts that are bad because of their randomness.

I would rather have a contract creator with a user interface that lets me pick my own objectives and how many tourists and where I want to take them (if there are volounteers that is).
I really am pointing for more types of tourists like those who wish to go for a walk on the mun or those willing to experience g's

I'd rather be able to offer tours, rather than the tourists picking where they want to go without consulting me.

I have a perfectly fine space station in Minmus orbit, it has a few spare beds, and I send ships there relatively often for science experiments (thanks to the lovely mod StationScience). I clearly wouldn't mind sending tourists up there and back along with the shipments. However, I have no such infrastructure on Duna and I don't make regular trips there, so it's not a destination I'd advertise to tourists. Why can't I advertise "affordable charter trips to low Minmus orbit" while making it publicly clear that no (reasonable) amount of money could convince me to take a tourist to Duna or Eve? A small setting somewhere, listing destinations for tourism, could make tourist contracts a lot more fun. I specify where I want to take tourists, and they take the offer or leave it, rather than suggesting new, outlandish places for me to haul their sorry buttocks.

I'd like that. Set your main objectives, then you get 1-5 'offers' for different rewards, while each one may have additional objectives in the SOI: You have an offer for 5 tourists to Minmus? Great! We'll pay you 20k a head, but while you're out there if you could rescue Bobfred, who we accidentally left behind in orbit during a bathroom break... That kind of thing.
